intro: Chrysanthemum flavovirens var. stapfianum, commonly known as the Stapfian yellow-green chrysanthemum, is a perennial flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-green flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate and colorful blooms that appear in late summer to early autumn.
